title: Knife Crime Continues To Rise Despite Victorian Police Confiscation Of Weapons | 10 News
description: Knife crime in Victoria continues to rise, despite a record 15,000 knives and machetes being pulled from Melbourne’s streets in the past 12 months. Senior officers say they will relentlessly pursue offenders, as the Allan Government pledges more jail time for criminals who use blades to threaten their victims. title: How AI Is Taking Over The Modelling Industry | 10 News+
description: There are fears computer-generated models are replacing real-life models and going against today's beauty standards, sending the wrong message to younger generations. It comes after clothing brand H&M recently made headlines over plans to clone 30 models, with permission, and create digital versions of them. title: Artificial Intelligence Models, Aussie Bogan 'War & Peace', Prisoner's Plea For Vegemite | 10 News+
description: Video showing the police who served Hannah Clarke’s husband with AVO papers has emerged. Bodycam footage shows the officers appearing to offer guidance to Rowan Baxter, who would go on to murder his estranged wife and children. The police can be seen telling Baxter to “document some stuff” to “counter” Clarke’s protection order.  There are fears computer-generated models are replacing real-life models and going against today's beauty standards, sending the wrong message to younger generations. It comes after clothing brand H&M recently made headlines over plans to clone 30 models, with permission, and create digital versions of them.  A Melbourne writer is making global news for his retelling of a literary classic, with an Aussie twist. Andrew Tesoriero, who uses the pen name Andre Louis, is in the process of rewriting the 19th century classic 'War and Peace' but translating it into 'bogan speak'.  Sussan Ley has made it clear that the topic of migration is next on her agenda. The Opposition Leader says her party is planning to release an immigration policy in the coming weeks, with a focus on lowering migration numbers she says are too high. It comes as Ley tries to secure some unity in her party after the Nationals and right-wing liberals got their way on net zero. title: Trump Wants Epstein Files Released, Calls It A 'Democrat Problem' | 10 News
description: US President Donald Trump has once again backed the full release of the Epstein files, saying all of convicted child sex offender Jeffrey Epstein's "friends were democrats".  The President has called on the House Republicans to vote to release the notorious files, saying he and his administration have "nothing to do with Epstein".  Trump's push comes as the US Justice Department confirms investigations into the democrat links Trump mentioned, including former president Bill Clinton, and banks JP Morgan and Chase, former Treasury Secretary Larry Summers and LinkedIn founder Reid Hoffman (who is a prominent democratic donor). title: France Makes ‘Historic’ Deal To Sell Ukraine 100 Warplanes | 10 News
description: France will deliver up to 100 Rafale warplanes To Ukraine over the next 10 years under a deal signed by President Emmanuel Macron and his counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday.  President Zelenskyy hailed the move as "historic", after signing the letter of intent with Macron at an air base near Paris.  The announcement comes as Zelenskyy visited Paris seeking to bolster his country's long-term military capacity to fight Russia's invasion. title: United Nations Security Council Votes To Endorse Trump’s Gaza Plan | 10 News
description: The UN Security Council has voted to adopt a US-drafted resolution endorsing Trump's peace plan for Gaza, including the deployment of an international stabilisation force for the Palestinian enclave.  The resolution passed with 13 votes in favour, zero votes against, and Russia and China abstaining.  However, Hamas has rejected the resolution, saying it fails to meet Palestinians' rights and demands.
